The 2021 ABP included in the DMS is indicative since it was done in July 2020 with an estimated gross financing need for 2021

Assessment: Partial ABP published  with a delay < 3 months
Explanation: The Eastern Caribbean Securities Exchange posts an annual calendar for the issuances of government securities (i.e., considered as a proxy for an ABP for domestic securities) covering January 13, 2021 to December 16, 2021

Explanation: The annual calendar for the issuances of government securities for FY21-22 published on the CB website (i.e., considered as a proxy for an ABP) in July 2021 (i.e., at the beginning of the fiscal year)

Assessment: Partial ABP published  with a delay < 3 months

Explanation: There is no publication date, but the ABP reflects the financing plan included in the DMS (Table 4), which was conducted in April 2021. Thus the ABP must have been published within a delay > 3 months

Assessment: ABP published with a delay > 3 months
Explanation: The plan on the MoF website was published on May 12, 2021 (i.e., delay > 3 months)

Assessment: Partial ABP published with a delay > 3 months
Explanation: Table 19 of the DMS published on May 15, 2021 (i.e., a delay > 3 months) presents an ABP for domestic borrowing. There is no breakdown of external financing by key instrument

No reporting is expected. There are no guarantees and PPPs; and no outstanding arrears.

No reporting is expected on additional debt statistics.
The BL reports and quantifies both explicit and implicit CLs (Chapter 6 incl. Table 6.1.). The Public Debt Situation Report presents also the guaranteed debt by beneficiary (Table 7)
Reporting on guarantees  is expected. The annual Debt Report Bulletin provides guaranteed debt by beneficiary as well other existing CLs
Reporting on guarantees  and PPP is expected. The debt bulletin reports and quantifies both explicit and implicit CLs (Table 17)
Reporting is expected on guarantees  and PPPs. The 2021 FRS quantiifes existing CLs
Reporting is expected on guarantees  and PPPs. A Fiscal Risk Appendix is annexed to the 2021 BL with quantification of existing CLs (Table A)

Reporting is expected on guarantees  and PPPs and the stock of domestic arrears. The latest Public Debt Bulletin reports on domestic arrears (page 26) and explicit CLs by beneficiary. The Fiscal Strategy Statement (2019-2023) discusses PPP-related CLs (annex 6)

Reporting is expected on guarantees and PPPs . Fiscal Risk Statement 2021/22 reports on guaranteed debt by beneficiary (table 5) and PPP-related guarantees (table 7). The debt statistical bulletin reports also on guaranteed debt by beneficiary (page 23)

Reporting is expected on guarantees and legal disputes at the minimum. The Public Debt Bulletin 2020 reports on guaranteed debt by beneficiary (Table 18) and a comprehensive fiscal risk analysis for 2021 is publicly available (incl. on legal disputes pages 44-45)

Reporting is expected on guaranteed debt. The Quarterly Public Debt Bulletin (March 2020) reports on guaranteed debt by beneficiary. The Fiscal Strategy Statement (FY2021/22) has a section on CLs (pages 13-14)

Reporting is expected on guaranteed debt. The Public Debt Bulletin (December 2020) reports on guaranteed debt by beneficiary (Figure 13). A stand-alone document reports as well on active soverign guarantees. An inaugural FRS has been produced and published in 2021.
Reporting is expected on guaranteed debt. The annual debt bulletin has a dedicated section on CLs, including on loan guarantees with names of beneficiaries (section 7.1)

Reporting is expected on guaranteed debt and the stock of domestic debt arrears. The Mid-Year Public Debt Report (2020/2021) reports  on arrears (page 8) and the previous debt report (2019/2020) reports on guaranteed debt by beneficiary (Table 6)
Reporting is expected on guaranteed debt and account payables. The latest Debt Portfolio Review reports on guaranteed debt by beneficiary (Table 21) and account payables (Table 9)
Reporting on guarantees  and PPPs is expected. The Statistical Public Debt Bulletin (2021- Q1) reports on loan guarantees only.

Reporting on guarantees  and PPP and the stock of domestic arrears is expected. The monthly debt statistical bulletin provides with data on guaranteed debt (with name of beneficiaries), and expenditures float and arrears.
Reporting is expected on gurantees related to PPPs. The explanatory note for the 2022 draft BL includes a fiscal risks section covering CLs, but omits to discuss PPPs and  guarantees

Reporting is expected on guarantees  and PPPs. The current DMS reports on loan guarantees with names of beneficiaries (Table 5). The annual Budget Review and Outlook Paper does not yet list and quantifies CLs.

Reporting is expected on guarantees  and PPPs as well domestic and external arrears. The Fiscal Risk Report (2022) reports on guaranteed debt at end-2020 by beneficiary and the Public Debt Report (2020) reports on arrears. PPP-related guarantees are not reported.

Reporting is expected on guarantees  and PPPs and the stock of domestic arrears. The Contingent Liabilities Annual Fieldwork Report FY 2019/202 and the Strategy to Clear and Prevent Domestic Arrears reports provide most of the expected information. Section 2.4 of the CL report fails to report on  guarantees involving PPPS contracted before the enactment of the 2015 PPP Act (page 6)

Reporting is expected on guarantees  and PPPs and the stock of domestic arrears. The annual Debt Report provides information on both the loan guarantees and the arrears. A 2021 FRS is available. It fails to report on PPP-related guarantees

Reporting is expected on guarantees and PPPs and the stock of domestic arrears. The 2020 MYEFO reports on loan guarantees by beneficiary (Table 28) and the stock of arrears (Table 19). PPP-related guarantees are not  disclosed
Reporting is expected on guarantees  and PPPs . The Statistical Debt Bulletin (September 2021) reports on guaranteed debt  by beneficiary (Table 18).
The FRS for 2020 omits to discuss outstanding arrears to non-Paris Club official creditors. There is no guaranteed debt at end-2020

Reporting on loan guarantees and domestic arrears identified in January 2019 and to be fully repaid by 2022  is expected. While a fiscal risk analysis for 2021 is publicly available with details on guarantees, the stock of domestic arrears is not provided

Reporting on guarantees  and PPPs, the stock of domestic arrears, and collaterilized debt is expected. The Annual Public 2020 Debt Report reports on guaranteed debt by beneficiary (page 34). It does not report on the stock of domestic arrears (although a reference is made to some arrears in page 75). The 2020 Fiscal Strategy Document does not quantify CLs

Reporting on guarantees  and  PPP (Orange Congo DRC), the stock of domestic arrears and collateralized debt is expected. The 2020 Annual Debt Report provides details on loan guarantees, including the name of the beneficiary, and arrears. The MT budget framework attached to the 2021 draft BL includes a matrix of fiscal risks, but omits those related to CLs (Table 12).

Reporting is expected only on the stock of domestic and external arrears. The latest Public Debt Report provides information and data on external arrears (Table 1), but omits to discuss domestic arrears. The Budget Strategy FY2022 does not report either on the stock of domestic arrears

Reporting is expected on guarantees, the Mamohato PPP and the stock of domestic debt arrears . Publicly guaranteed debt by beneficiary as end-March 2021 is published in the Public Debt Transparency Report, 2020/2021- Q3 (Table 4).

Reporting is expected on guarantees and PPPs, the stock of domestic arrears, and collaterilized debt. The public debt report provides data on guaranteed debt by beneficiary, domestic arrears and PPP-related guarantees. No information is provided on collaterilized debt

Reporting is expected on guarantees  and PPPs the stock of arrears and collateralized debt. The latest statistical bulletin reports on loan guarantees by beneficiary (Table 6.1) and the stock of arrears (Table 1 and Figure 3).
Reporting is expected on guarantees  and PPPs at the minimum. The Public Debt Report (2020) provides the list of loan guarantees by beneficiary (Table 13).

Reporting is expected on guarantees  and PPPs and the stock of domestic and external arrears. The Government Debt Portfolio Review (2020-Q4) reports on guaranteed debt by beneficiary and the stock of external arrears. It fails to report on the stock of domestic arrears.

Reporting is expected on guarantees  and 1 PPP (Sinergie concession contract), the stock of domestic and external arrears and collaterilized debt. The quarterly debt bulletin reports on guaranteed debt by beneficiary and domestic and external arrears. It fails to report on collaterilized debt.
Reporting is expected on guaranteed debt and the stock of domestic arrears. The debt bulletin reports on loan guarantees with name of beneficiaries (Table 12), but omit to report on domestic arrears.
Reporting on the stock of domestic and external arrears is expected. The latest debt statistical bulletin does not report on arrears.
Reporting on loan guarantees, the stock of domestic and external arrears and collaterilized debt is expected.
Reporting on  guarantees related to PPPs is expected.

Reporting on guarantees  and PPPs is expected. The Medium Term Macroeconomic Policy Statement 2020-2021/2022-2023 reports on total amounts guarantees as of May 2020, but fails to provide details by beneficiary.

Reporting on guarantees  and PPPs and the stock of domestic, external arrears and collaterilized debt is expected. The MT budget framework attached to the 2020 draft BL discusses briefly fiscal riks, but omits to cover comprehensively risks related to CLs.
Reporting on guarantees  and PPPs and the stock of domestic and external arrears is expected.
Reporting on guarantees  and PPP (Mutsamudu Port) and the stock of external arrears is expected.
Reporting on guaranteed debt is expected.
Reporting is expected on letter of guarantees and PPP-related guarantees, the stock of domestic and external arrears, and collaterilized debt.

Reporting is expected on guarantees, PPPs and the stock of domestic debt arrears.
Reporting is expected on guarantees related to loans and PPPs. The annual bulletin does not itemize the guaranteed debt by beneficiary
Reporting is expected on guarantees and PPPs. The Public Debt Report does not itemize guaranteed debt by beneficiary.
Reporting is expected on guarantees  and PPPs. The Debt portfolio report (2020) does not provide the name of the beneficiaries (Section 7).
Reporting is expected on guarantees  and PPPs. The 2021 BL discusses the need to monitor Cls, but does not quantify them (volume 1, page 51).
Reporting is expected on guarantees and PPPs.
Reporting is expected on guarantees  and PPPs.

Reporting is expected on guarantees  and PPPs and the stock of domestic and external arrears.
Reporting is expected on guarantees  and PPPs and the stock of domestic and extenal arrears.
